intro: Faba faba, commonly known as the broad bean, is a leguminous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its large, flat pods that contain several edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has trifoliate leaves with a heart-shaped leaflet. Its flowers are usually purple or white and are followed by the development of the pods. The seeds are rich in protein and have been cultivated for thousands of years as a food crop.
